intro: Benthamia macra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved benthamia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Benthamia macra is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitats.
